data.title: Seeking information on Tuskegee Airmen
data.meta_description: I am seeking information on the Tuskegee Airmen. Personal records / Military records that would yield information such as date of births, place of birth, date of
data.text:
Dear Mr. Partain,

Thank you for posting your request on History Hub!

We searched the National Archives Catalog for records pertaining to the Tuskegee Airmen and located the following records:

Academic Records, 1942 - 1943 and Headquarters Records, 1941 - 1947 of the Tuskegee Institute in the Records of the Army Air Forces (Record Group 18)

World War II Combat Operations Reports, 1941 - 1946 in the Records of the Army Air Forces (Record Group 18) that includes sortie reports for the 99th Fighter Squadron, V Fighter Command: 301st Fighter Squadron Mission Reports February - June 1944;and Narrative Mission Reports and Daily Operations Reports of the 332nd Fighter Group.

Unit Annual Reports, 1940 - 1949 in the Records of the Office of the Surgeon General (Army) (Record Group 112) that includes reports for the 332nd Fighter Group.

General Correspondence, 1941 - 5/1944 of the Army Air Forces Office of the Commanding General in the Records of the Army Air Forces (Record Group 18) that includes records related to the Tuskegee Airmen under files 220.31 Tuskegee and 323.7 Station for Colored Troops.

Hastie-Gibson Subject Files, 1940 - 1948 in the Records of the Office of the Secretary of War (Record Group 107) that includes the files 99th Pursuit, 332nd Fighter Group, 477th Bomber Group, Tuskegee Army Air Field, 1944-48, and Tuskegee Air Base, AL, 1941-44 and Brown, Willa B., Coffey School of Aeronautics.

General Correspondence, 1941 - 1945 of the Office of the Assistant Secretary of War in the Records of the Office of the Secretary of War (Record Group 107) that includes the files 291.2, Negro Troops, Negro Air Forces Units.

General Correspondence, 3/1943 - 11/1945 of Under Secretary of War Robert P. Patterson in the Records of the Office of the Secretary of War (Record Group 107) thar includes the file “Interviews with Negro Aviators, July 20, 1943.”

For more information about the records listed above, please contact the National Archives at College Park - Textual Reference (RDT2) via email atarchives2reference@nara.gov.

RDT2 also has custody of microfilm copies of operational records relating to U.S. Army Air Force units. We searched the Air Force History index to the microfilm and located 26 files that pertain to the 332nd Fighter Group, 9 files pertaining to the 99th Fighter Squadron, 5 files that pertain to the 100th Fighter Squadron, 12 files pertaining to the 301st Fighter Squadron, 21 files that pertain to the 302nd Fighter Squadron, 2 files that pertain to the 477th Bomb Group and 7 files pertaining to the 477th Composite Group. In addition, we searched for “Tuskegee” and located 222 records. Please read the brief Abstract to determine which records you are interested in and click on the specific PDF icon. In the PDF listing, the IRISREF is the microfilm reel number and note the FRAME and FRAMELST numbers for the location on the reel. If the reel number begins with A, B or C, please contact RDT2 via email at archives2reference@nara.gov for more information about them.

If the reel number begins with D - Z, the microfilm is still security classified and RDT2 will not be able to make the reel available to you. The original paper copy from which the film was created is still in the custody of the Air Force Historical Research Agency (AFHRA) and has been declassified. To obtain copies of these records, please follow the instructions on this page. If there is no IRISREF information, only AFHRA has the records.

Next, we located Photographs of Tuskegee Airmen and Other African Americans, and Women in the U.S. Air Force, 1941 - 1981, Photographs of Activities, Facilities and Personnel, ca. 1940 - ca. 1983 and "National Air and Space Museum Archival Videodiscs": U.S. Air Force Pre-1954 Still Photograph Collection, 1985 - 1995 in the Records of U.S. Air Force Commands, Activities, and Organizations (Record Group 342) and Official Portraits of U.S. Army Air Force Pilots, Tuskegee, Alabama, 1943 - 1946 in the Records of the Army Air Forces (Record Group 18) that include photographs related to Tuskegee Airmen. Some photographs of the Tuskegee Airmen have been digitized and are available through the Catalog. For more information about non-digitized photographs, please contact the National Archives at College Park - Still Pictures (RDSS) at stillpix@nara.gov.

Copies of most of the monthly rosters from November 1912 - 1943 and morning reports from November 1, 1912 to 1959 for Army (including Army Air Force) units are in the custody of the National Archives at St. Louis (RL-SL). For information about these records, please contact RL-SL via email at stl.archives@nara.gov. Rosters for Army units serving in World War II from 1944 - 1946 were destroyed in accordance with Army disposition authorities.

Further, we suggest you review the following resources for information that may be relevant to your research:

477th Fighter Group History available on the website of the 477th Fighter Group

Tuskegee Airmen History available on the website of the Tuskegee Airmen Inc.

A blog post on the Tuskegee Airmen available on the website of the National Museum of African American History and Culture

Resources available on the website of the Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site (U.S. National Park Service)

The Tuskegee Airmen available on the website of the Tuskegee University

CAF Red Tail Squadron:| America's Tribute to the Tuskegee Airmen

Tuskegee Airmen — 1941 – 1945 | National Air and Space Museum

We hope this is helpful. Best of luck with your research!
